title: Roles
content:
Service Management has built-in roles according to industry best practice recommendations. Large companies might have several people assigned to the same role. Smaller organizations might have more than one role assigned to one person.

Maintaining a role-based view of the organization ensures you adhere to the best practice model. You can adhere to the best practice model, no matter who you assign to the role or how you divide the responsibilities associated with the role. For example, if your company is large, you may have separate process designers and process owners assigned to each module. A smaller company might assign both roles to one person for each module.

Permissions are controls within applications. When assigned, they enable you to complete certain Service Management tasks, such as adding updated information to a record. Permissions are an administrative strategy to control access to records and limit the number of people who can view, create, update, or delete records. Permissions to view particular data domains limit your ability to view only records that are tagged with those domains. For more information, see Data domain segmentation.

  • If you have development and production tenants, you must make all configuration changes on the development tenant. For more information about synchronizing the tenants, see Dev2Prod - How to synchronize your development and production tenants.
  • For information on DND roles and how to configure DND authorization, see Configure authorization for Design and Deploy. 

Out of the box roles

Service Management has preconfigured roles that are consistent with ITIL recommendations and naming conventions. Service Management also has custom roles to support various users and modules, including the On-Premise Bridge, MT Console, and Service Portal. To view these roles, from the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > Roles.

You can assign these roles to IT agent, modify the permissions associated with a role, or make other changes to meet the requirements of your environment.

A role indicated with a lock icon is a system role, which isn't editable.

Role Description
Application Analyst Creates, updates, and deletes optimization records; creates surveys and evaluates survey results for migrating the application to the cloud.
Application Owner Creates, updates, and deletes applications and road maps.
Application Portfolio Administrator Assigns roles for the APM module defines workflows for applications and their optimizations.
Application Portfolio Manager Creates and updates application portfolios; runs portfolio analysis.
Asset & Configuration Administrator Configuration administrator for Service Asset and Configuration Management.
Asset & Configuration Manager Configuration manager for Service Asset and Configuration Management.
Business Intelligence Integration

Customer role for the Business Intelligence integration.

Don’t assign this role to account users because it will prevent them from logging in to Agent Interface and Service Portal. 
Catalog Administrator Administrator of the Service Catalog.
Change Approver Evaluates and authorizes (or disapproves) changes.
Change Assignee Responsible for assigned change.
Change Coordinator Coordinates all requests for changes throughout their lifecycle.
Change Manager Manages changes and functions as the point of escalation.
Change Owner Reviews and manages assigned changes.
Change Process Owner Accountable for all change-related activities. Functions as the champion, advocate, and design lead of the change module.
Change Requestor Submits requests for changes.
Change Task Assignee Closes assigned change tasks.
CMP Agent

Manages:

  • Service Design and Deployment
  • Cloud Cost Reporting
  • Operations Orchestration    
Contract Manager Manages external vendors and contracts with vendors.
Favorite Views Owner

Creates public views.

This is a granular role, granting permission to a single area. Combining it with another role that already has the same permission would be redundant. But you can use it to add this permission to someone who has another role that doesn't grant the permission to create public views, without altering that other role.
Financial Manager Manages financial aspects of the assets, including devices, licenses, and infrastructure and peripheral assets.
Guest (Deprecated)
Don't use this role, because it's deprecated.
Idea Administrator Configuration administrator for Idea Management.
Idea Reviewer Reviews, categorizes, and approves/rejects ideas.
Incident Analyst Investigates and resolves assigned incidents.
Incident Coordinator Coordinates resolution and closure of incidents.
Incident Manager Manages incident resolution and functions as the escalation focal point.
Incident Process Owner Accountable for all incident-related activities. Functions as the champion, advocate, and design lead of the incident module.
Integration Administrator Has full access to the Integration module and all permissions to manage integrations.
IT User Has full access to all functional modules, including some configuration rights. Has read-only access to foundational data.
Knowledge Administrator Has all permissions assigned to manage Knowledge Management article publication.
Knowledge Contributor Creates, edits, and reviews knowledge articles for an internal or external audience.
Knowledge Publisher Publishes knowledge articles to an internal or external audience.
MT Administrator Manages the multi-tenant (MT) environment for a provider tenant. This is the only user, along with the Tenant Admin, who has permissions to add users who can access managed customer data.
MT Agent Manages and is able to access managed customer data. You can add only users with this role to the list of users who can view incident or request data for a managed customer in the Vendor Management > Managed Customer tab.
OPB Remote Agent

Integrates On-Premise Bridge internal processes.

Don’t assign this role to account users because it will prevent them from logging in to Agent Interface and Service Portal. 
Portfolio Manager Analyzes proposals, defines the workflow, and manages business objectives.
Problem Analyst Investigates and resolves assigned problems and known errors.
Problem Coordinator Coordinates problem records through their lifecycle.
Problem Manager Manages problem resolution and functions as the escalation focal point.
Problem Process Owner Accountable for all problem-related activities. Functions as the champion, advocate, and design lead of the problem module.
Problem Task Assignee Closes assigned problem tasks.
Procurement Manager Manages procurement processes such as creating and issuing POs and receiving assets.
Program Manager Owns programs. Can add content and is responsible for managing related projects together.
Project Manager Owns projects. Responsible for managing all aspects of a project's success.
Project Portfolio Manager Owns project portfolios. Can add content and is responsible for high-level management.
Proposal Administrator Creates approval definitions for proposals.
Proposal Creator Creates, publishes, and abandons proposals.
Proposal Reviewer Reviews, categorizes, and approves/rejects proposals.
Release Coordinator Coordinates release records through their lifecycle.
Release Process Owner Accountable for all release-related activities. Functions as the champion, advocate, and design lead of the release module.
Reports Publisher Configures charts and graphs for reporting.
Request Approver Business approver for a request.
Resource Manager Creates and edits resource types.
SACM Integration Customer role for external integrations.
Self-Service Portal Administrator Manages the Theme Settings and Feature Settings of the Service Portal.
Self-Service Portal User Service Portal end user has permissions to view the Services catalog, search for knowledge articles, submit questions, and respond to questions submitted.
Self-Service Restricted Portal User Restricted Service Portal end user has permissions to view the Services catalog, search for knowledge articles, submit questions, and respond to questions submitted. For this role, the User privacy control in the self-service portal option is selected by default.
Service Level Manager Negotiates Service Level Agreements and manages Service Level Management processes.
Service Request Agent Assignee who fulfills service requests.
Service Request Coordinator Assigns and coordinates service requests.
Service Request Manager Manages the Service Request module and functions as the escalation focal point.
Service Request Process Owner Accountable for all service request-related activities. Functions as the champion, advocate, and design lead of the Service Request module.
Service Request Task Assignee Completes and closes assigned service request tasks.
Software Manager Manages the life cycle of software assets and license optimization.
Stockroom Admin Manages stockrooms and their content.
Strong Identity Validation Bypass

Can approve tasks without strong identity validation.

This role isn't relevant for users with the Tenant Admin role.
Survey Editor Creates and manages surveys.
Tenant Admin Super user role that has permissions for everything in the application. You are recommended to assign the tenant admin role to a small number of users (at least two) per tenant system. 

Although you don't enable any permissions on the UI, the Tenant Admin role has permissions for everything in the tenant system.
Vendor Catalog Administrator Manages vendor catalogs and vendor catalog items.
Vendor Liaison Interfaces with external third-party support representatives for incident resolution.

How to create a role

To create a role, you must either have the Tenant Admin role or have appropriate role management permissions. For more information, see Assign permissions to a role for Administration modules. 

Service Management provides a robust set of roles that map to ITIL best practice recommendations. You can create new roles to meet the needs of your organization. After you create a new role, you can assign permissions to the role.

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > Roles.
  2. Click Add at the top of the left pane.
  3. Type a Name for the role.
  4. Type a Code for the role. This is used to identify the role internally.
    Note: The combination of Code and Application must be unique in the system. This means that you can have roles with the same code, as long as they are for different applications.
  5. Select the Application where the role is used, as described in the following table.
    Value Capability Description
    SMAX Service Management A role used to access the Agent Interface and Service Portal. 
    DND Design and Deploy (DND) A role used to access Design and Deploy (DND). DND is part of Cloud Management.
    CGRO Cloud Cost Reporting A role used to access Cloud Cost Reporting. Cloud Cost Reporting is part of Cloud Management.
    OO Operations Orchestration (OO) A role used to access OO Containerized.
    AUDIT Audit service A role used to access Audit data. 
    CMDB Universal Discovery and CMDB (UD/UCMDB) A role used to access classic or containerized UD/UCMDB.
    CONTENTSTORE Content Store A role used to access Content Store. Content Store is part of Cloud Management.
  6. Click OK or Add another to save the new role.

The new role has no default permissions. Your next step is to update the role with the specific permissions that you want the role assignee to have.

Read the following section for how to assign permissions to Service Management roles.

Ask a suite admin to assign permissions for roles used in these Service Management capabilities: DND, Cloud Cost Reporting, Operations Orchestration, Audit, and Content Store.

For roles used in UD/UCMDB, assign permissions in the UCMDB Local Client.

How to edit role permissions

New roles have no initial permissions. After you add a new role, you must assign specific permissions that are appropriate to the role. Occasionally, you might need to edit existing roles by changing existing permissions.

To update role permissions:

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > Roles.

  2. If necessary, expand any of the following sections to assign or change permissions.

  3. Click Save on the toolbar.

General

Permission Description
Log in to the application Login rights are the lowest level of permission granted.
Permission to manage Service Design and Deployment Permission to access the Design and Deployment Operations menu items.
The permission is available only when you set Enable Service Design and Deployment to On in Application Settings.

Permission to manage Cloud Management Platform FinOps 

 Permission to access the Cloud Cost Reporting menu items.
The permission is available only when you set Enable Cloud Cost Reporting to On in Application Settings.
Permission to manage Operations Orchestration Permission to access the OO menu items.
The permission is available only when you set Enable Operations Orchestration to On in Application Settings.

Reports & Views

Permission Description
Administer reports Permission to update or delete all reports (Public, Private, and Group reports created by the user and by others).
A user with the Administer reports and Define schedule tasks for email reports permissions can't add group reports to a report schedule if the user has no access to the group reports.
Create public reports Permission to create public dashboard reports and charts, and further update and delete them.
If you revoke a user's Create public reports permission, the user can still update or delete public reports that the user created before the revocation.
Create group reports Permission to create reports that are available only to the members of specified user groups, and further update and delete them.
If you revoke a user's Create group reports permission, the user can still update or delete group reports that the user created before the revocation, but can't edit their Groups field.
Define schedule tasks for email reports Permission to create, update, and delete scheduled reports. The system will send reports to a group of recipients through email.
Administer favorite views Permission to update and delete all Public and Group views, created either by the user or by others.
Create public favorite views Permission to save searches as public favorite views, and further update and delete them.
Create group favorite views Permission to save searches as favorite views that are accessible only to the members of specified user groups, and further update and delete them.
Create public dashboards Permission to create dashboards for sharing with all users. 
Create group dashboards Permission to create dashboards for sharing with a group of users.
Access OData API Permission to access OData API. See Use OData for BI integration.

Security

This section contains the following permission settings.

Area Description
Data domains

To add authorization to access records in all data domains, select the View all data domains check box.

To add authorization to access records in specific data domains, click inside the text box and select the data domains that you want to include.

To delete a specific data domain from the list, click .

To change role permission from view all data domains to view only specific data domains:

Deselect View all data domains and then select the specific data domains that you want to assign. 

For more information, see  Data domain segmentation.
Encryption domains
  1. Select the Encryption domain administrator to grant the role the permission to create encryption domains. 
  2. Go to the Administration menu visibility section, and select Visible for People to make the People menu item visible to the selected role so that the role can access encryption domains from People > Encryption Domains.
Encrypted data

Select the Permission to clear encrypted data to grant the role the permission to clear data from encrypted fields (which have a Logical type of LARGE_TEXT, MEDIUM_TEXT, or RICH_TEXT).

Note that this permission doesn't allow users to clear encrypted attachments.
Strong identity validation bypass Select the Permission to bypass strong identity validation to grant the role the permission to bypass strong identity validation when approving tasks. 
User privacy control in the self-service portal

Select the User privacy control in the self-service portal to prevent Service Portal users from retrieving other users' information, such as name and avatar.  Specifically, the user information will change to "anonymous."

For all portal users (Login into the application is not checked in all granted roles), as long as one of their granted roles has User privacy control in the self-service portal checked, they are considered a restricted user on the portal side.

This option only takes effect when the Log in to the application option isn't selected. That is, all agents will not be restricted on both the agent and the portal sides.

A few Service Portal features are not supported when privacy control is used. You must disable these Service Portal settings:
  • Followers section of Request – Disable this in Portal settings
  • Ideas - Disable this in Portal settings
  • Approvals Delegation 
  • Q&A
  • Request on Behalf (To be supported in a future release)
Grant default record type permissions for Service Portal usage

Select the Grant default record type permissions for Service Portal usages option for end users to access the Service Portal features, such as viewing the Services catalog, searching for knowledge articles, submitting questions, and responding to questions submitted.

For the Self-Service Portal User and Self-Service Restricted Portal User roles, this option is selected by default.

Record Type

Permission Description
View Enables you to view records of the selected record type.
Delete

Enables you to delete records of the selected record type.

To ensure data integrity, most of the out-of-the-box entities don't allow deletion from the user interface. We recommend using entity lifecycle to manage OOB records instead of deleting them.

Users with this permission can delete records for custom entities, though.

This permission also controls the ability to delete records by using the API.
Update Enables you to update records of the selected record type in the grid, including adding comments. 
Admin Enables you to update the selected record type in the studio module.
Create Enables you to create records of the selected record type.
Comments Enables you to edit or delete any existing comments on records of the selected record type.
This permission only takes effect when you also have the Update permission.
Access Control Override This permission enables you to bypass the record-level access control (RLAC) configuration for the record type. For information about RLAC, see Record-level access control.

To add permission to access a certain type of record:

  1. Click Add.

  2. Choose the record type from the list, and select the relevant permissions.

  3. Click OK. The system will display the new record type permission in the Record Type list.

To remove a record type permission, choose the record type from the list and clear the relevant permission.

Resources

Permission Description
Create Enables you to create resources.
Delete Enables you to delete resources.
View Enables you to view resources.
Update Enables you to update resources.

To add permission to access a resource:

  1. Click Add.
  2. Choose the resource from the list, and select the relevant permissions. For information about what resources to select when configuring role permissions for a feature, see the specific feature documentation. 
    Note that the resources available in the list are based on all the tables at the database level. Many resources are of an internal system nature, and you don't need to use them. For this reason, these resources aren't documented. 

Resource list

Resource Description
License Indicates the suite license.

To remove a resource permission:

  1. Choose the resource from the list.
  2. Clear the relevant permission.

Knowledge Management

Permission Description
Import articles Retrieve articles from external sources.
Publish articles to the Service Portal Enable self-service users to access knowledge articles.
Update articles that are currently published in the Service Portal Make changes to published articles.
Hide articles that are currently published in the Service Portal Remove published articles.

Questions & Answers

Permission Description
Ask questions Enables a Service Portal user to post questions in the portal. For more information, see How to authorize knowledge handling in the Service Portal.
Answer questions Enables a Service Portal user to respond to questions posted in the portal. For more information, see How to authorize knowledge handling in the Service Portal.
Moderate user questions and answers Enables the Knowledge Contributor, Knowledge Publisher, or Knowledge Administrator to respond to questions posted in the Service Portal, and to review answers for relevance or accuracy. For more information, see How to moderate Q&A.

Live Support

Permission Description
Be able to request chat support In the Service Portal, only a user with this permission can request an online chat. This applies in cases where chat support is otherwise available through the chosen offering. If a user doesn't have this permission, the request chat option isn't displayed.

Aviator

Permission Description
Access Aviator Only a user with this permission can use the Aviator capability.
Administrator Allows the selected role to access and update configurations on the AI Studio page.

On-Call Schedule

Permission Description
Be able to access on-call schedule Only a user with this permission can view On-Call Schedule Management. If a user doesn't have this permission, the feature isn't displayed.

Change Management

Permission Description
Can create an emergency change Only a user with this permission can create an emergency change.
Allows access to the Change Analytics module Only a user with this permission can access the Change Analytics module.
Allows configuration of KPI goals and thresholds Only a user with this permission can configure KPI goals and thresholds.

Service Portal administration

Permission Description
Customize the look and feel of the Service Portal Only a user with this permission can change the Service Portal.

Approvals

Permission Description
Override approvals of

Grant permission to override approvals for the following record types:

  • Request
  • Change
  • Article
  • Idea
  • Proposal
  • Release

SACM

Permission Description
Administrator Grant Service Asset and Configuration Management administration rights to the selected role.
Advanced import Only a user with this permission can implement the advanced record import method.
Service modeling Only a user with this permission can view the Service Modeling link if the Service Management belongs to a suite SSO-enabled account.
Enable 'Explore' in CI details Enables the role to use the Explore button in Service Management SACM records to view CI details in UCMDB Browser.
Guided modeling only
Only available when a user has 'Service modeling' permission. A user with 'Service modeling' and 'Guided modeling only' permission can use the service modeling feature only while using modeling templates.
This permission takes effect starting from UCMDB 25.4 only.

On-Premise Bridge/Integration

Permission Description
Administrator Grant On-Premise Bridge or Integration Studio-related administration rights to the selected role.

You can grant or remove access rights to complete endpoint tasks.

Endpoint Description
UCMDB 10.20 and later Access the Universal Configuration Management Database (UCMDB) repository.
Knowledge Indexing Submit knowledge articles for indexing to make them accessible to Service Portal end users.
Email Integration Access the Service Portal via email, without logging in.
Agentless Rest Executor 1.0 Access the REST API without the need for an OPB agent. 
Rest Executor 1.0 Access the REST API.
Rest Executor 2.0 Access the REST API.
JDBC Query
 Fetch data from a database server.
File system
 Fetch the content from a file.
LDAP Query
 Fetch values from the LDAP server.
Operations Orchestration Integrate with Operations Orchestration.
PPM Outbound Integration
Send Service Management ideas and proposals to Project and Portfolio Management (PPM).
PPM Optimization Solver Optimize scenarios in the Project and Program Management module.
LDAP Integration Access an LDAP server.

Analysis

Permission Description
Enable management of Hot Topic Analytics

Grant permission to manage the stop list in Hot Topic Analytics.

Notes:

  • To see the Manage stop list button in Hot Topic Analytics, the role needs the Enable management of Hot Topic Analytics permission and the Admin permission for the Article record type.
  • To use the Manage stop list button, the role additionally needs the following permissions for the Article record type: Create, View, Update, and Delete.

Tasks

Permission Description
Ability to view all tasks Grant permission to view all tasks on the task list. Without this permission, users can only view tasks assigned to them or their groups. 
This permission doesn't take effect for tenant administrators, as they can always view all tasks. 

Ability to edit locked task plans

Grant permission to edit task plans, including approval plans that have been locked through business rules. This permission doesn't take effect for tenant administrators, as they can always edit these task plans.

Administration menu visibility

Permission Description
Ability to view all administration modules

Grant the selected role the permission to view all modules under Administration in the main menu, including:

  • Modules not listed in this section. These modules (Studio, Lists, etc ) are accessible only to the Tenant Admin role and are therefore not listed here.
  • Modules listed in this section. These modules are accessible to roles other than Tenant Admin if you make them visible and grant further permissions for them to the role.   

For more information, see Assign permissions to role for Administration modules.

How to assign a role to a user

To assign a role to or unassign a role from a user, you must either have the Tenant Admin role or a role with appropriate user management permissions. For more information, see Assign permissions to a role for Administration modules.

You can assign one or more roles to a user in Service Management:

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People.

  2. Select the user to whom you want to assign a role.

    You can filter the list by clicking the Add filter  button, selecting Name, and typing the name of the user, or part thereof. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.

  3. Click in the Role field under System use definitions. Service Management displays a list of available roles.

  4. Select one or more roles to assign to the user.

  5. Click   Save on the toolbar.

How to unassign a role from a user

You can selectively remove any role from any user.

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People.
  2. Click Add filter  , select the Name field, and type the name of the user. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.
  3. Click in the Role field under System use definitions. For any role that appears in the field, click Delete to remove that role.
  4. If necessary, repeat the previous step to unassign other roles.
  5. Click   Save on the toolbar.

How to assign a role to a group

To assign a role or unassign a role from a group, you must either have the Tenant Admin role or a role with appropriate group management permissions. For more information, see Assign permissions to a role for Administration modules.

To assign a role to a group:

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > Groups.

  2. Select the group to which you want to assign a role.

    You can filter the list by clicking the Add filter  button, selecting Name, and typing the name of the group, or part thereof. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.

  3. Click in the Group Roles field under System use definitions. Service Management displays a list of available roles.

  4. Select one or more roles to assign to the group.

  5. Click   Save on the toolbar.
